title: Augusta County: John B. McGuffin to his Uncle, Aunt and Grandmother, August 30, 1864
summary: John McGuffin asks his uncle to return the $100 he enclosed in the letter to a friend from whom he had borrowed the money. He also mentions a fight in which a friend's son, and about 25 other people were killed.
keywords: Family, Death/Casualties, Desertion/Leave, American Civil War
